Definition: A risk is a disposition or the potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.
A textual entity that is a sentence in the interrogative mood.

Term Label: informed consent process with assenting process
Definition: An informed consent process that has an assent process as a proper part.

Term Label: obsolete informed consent form for human biospecimen collection
Definition: An informed consent form that documents a voluntary decision to deposit a human biospecimen.
An organization which has the principle goal of earning financial profit.
A document that either prescribes actions or prescribes the permissions, obligations, restrictions, or protections relating to public or legal policy.
A document with a set of printed or written questions with a choice of answers, devised for the purposes of a survey or statistical study.

A directive information entity that specifies the deontic roles that are produced, revoked, or modified following a process of informed consent, where those deontic roles inhere in the human subject consenter signing an informed consent form, and the investigator or organization leading a research study or providing health care.
A role inhering in a participant who does not meet all eligibility criteria defined within the study protocol.
A planned process that involves a human biological specimen originally collected for the purpose of treatment or a different investigation.
A date specification that designates the date when a project begins.

Term Label: obsolete contact person for questions about research subject rights
Definition: A person who is the contact for questions about research subject right.

Term Label: obsolete fully signed informed consent form
Definition: An informed consent form that has been signed by all participants.
A physical injury or illness that is a direct result of the treatment, or procedures required by the protocol, to which the subject would not have been exposed had they not participated in the study.

Term Label: obsolete participant candidate making voluntary decision of acceptance
Definition: A process in which a candidate makes a voluntary decision to join a study, following their consideration of adequate information presented to them regarding the study and their participation in it.
A regulatory document designed to prescribe an informed consent process or inputs in an informed consent process.
A rule in an informed consent regulatory document that prescribes an informed consent process and has part trigger condition description.

A directive information entity that enumerates the results if a trigger condition describing failure to comply with a rule is met, as determined by by a regulatory body that has authority within a jurisdiction, which, is also the location of a stasis of generically dependent continuant which has participant the regulatory document.

Term Label: obsolete explaining study purpose to participant candidate
Definition: As a partial process of inform the candidate about the study participating information, the purpose of the study will be explained to make sure that the candidate is informed adequately from his/her perspective.

Term Label: obsolete subject withdrawal with sample stored for unlimited time
Definition: A planned process that represents a study participant withdrawing from the study and agreeing to have the participant sample stored for unlimited time.
A population of human beings.
An act of anonymization that alters an information content entity by removing information content which identifies that individual.

Term Label: obsolete designing an informed consent form
Definition: A planned process that involves the design of an informed consent form.

Term Label: human subject signature section in informed consent form
Definition: A signature section in informed consent element that that is specified as a place to receive a signature from a human subject.
The personal identifiable information that is about a human subject that enrolled in a study.
A stasis of generically dependent continuant such that the information content that identifies an individual is not present.
A document part that specifies a method of contact in the future.
A time measurement datum of a study period.
A risk that is equal or lesser than those ordinarily encountered in daily life or during the performance of routine physical or psychological examinations or tests.
A filled multiple choice text entity that records a response indicating 'no' to a multiple choice question.
A planned process of acknowledgement, or agreement, to participate in a procedure or study, where the participant is incapable of informed consent.

A role that inheres in an individual who is authorized under applicable State or local law to consent on behalf of a child or incapable person to general medical care including participation in clinical research.

Term Label: obsolete subject withdrawal with sample stored for limited time
Definition: A planned process that represents a study participant withdrawing from the study and agreeing to have the participant sample stored for a limited time period.

An informed consent rule specification that specifies a course of action legally required to be taken. An example is that the organization leading a study is obliged to destroy the patient's biospecimens after 10 years as required in an informed consent form.

Term Label: obsolete explaining to participant candidate about the study participating information
Definition: A planned process that involves explanation to a human subject candidate with relevant study information, including study purpose, protocol, and human subject benefits and risks, that indicated in an informed consent form.
An informed consent process where the person who is being asked to whether or not they consent is an adult.
A rule in an informed consent regulatory document that prescribes deontic roles that may be realized in an unspecified range of activities, or which is subject to few restrictions.
None

Term Label: obsolete archiving signed scanned paper informed consent form
Definition: A process of storage of signed informed consent form when the form is in digital format.
None
A stasis in which some independent continuant bears some generically dependent continuant that remains unchanged during a temporal interval.

A descriptive information content entity that specifies the agent that is liable if a trigger condition describing failure to comply with a rule is met, as determined by by a regulatory body that has authority within a jurisdiction, which, is also the location of a stasis of generically dependent continuant which has participant the regulatory document.

Term Label: informed consent form for qualitative research involving children
Definition: An informed consent form for qualitative study that involves children.

Term Label: obsolete actual duration of study subject participation
Definition: Total length of time of subject's participation in a clinical study; from the time of enrollment to the completion of follow-up.
A medical record that records the history of a subject's treatment for alcohol abuse.

Term Label: ICO Classes to Move to D-Acts
Definition: None

Term Label: obsolete storage duration of signed informed consent form
Definition: A temporal interval that represents a period of time during which a signed informed consent form is stored.

Term Label: act of contact for future research
Definition: A planned process in which an agent contacts a participant of an informed consent process regarding opportunities related to future research.
A data item consisting of a unique identification code designating an informed consent.
An organizational function that involves the areas of information systems and computer science; and that plans, organizes, describes, or controls data resources.
An anonymized data item that is about a genomic sample.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
A document that contains information representing health-relevant qualities of a patient written in a chronological manner and that is primarily used for patient care in a clinical setting.

Term Label: obsolete partially filled informed consent form
Definition: An informed consent form that has been partially filled with required contents.
An organization that is operated without the principal goal of making a financial profit.
A directive information entity that prescribes actions that are impermissible.
A material entity (either a human being or an aggregate of humans such as an organization) which is active in a process or has the relevant capabilities of intentionality.

Term Label: obsolete project duration specification in informed consent form
Definition: A date that specifies a project duration date in an informed consent form.
A textual entity that is the recorded response to a multiple choice question.

Term Label: obsolete archiving signed paper informed consent form
Definition: A process of storage of signed informed consent form when the form is in physical paper form.
A role that inheres in human being and is an output of some participation in a research study.
None
A planned process in which a person decides not to provide consent.
A planned process of providing information according to prompts on a form.
An act of appraisal that examines some entity in order to confirm or ensure that a planned process occurred in the manner prescribed by some specification.

Term Label: obsolete contact person in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Definition: A person who is the contact for questions in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
A site where documents are preserved.

Term Label: complete informed consent form indicating consent
Definition: A document that has, as part, an incomplete informed consent form, along with some additional parts, such as a signature, stamp, or initials, which serve as a record to an act of consent having been performed using the incomplete informed consent form.
An informed consent rule specification that specifies an optional course of action that is an option for a participant to take.
A process that terminates a study.

Term Label: obsolete explaining risks of participation to participant candidate
Definition: The potential future harm that may arise from participating the study research is to be explained to candidate
A site defined by the boundaries of a deontic power that inheres in a regulatory body.
An investigation title that designates a clinical trial study, briefly identifying the purpose or design of the investigation.
An investigation that is conducted with a nonprofit purpose.

Term Label: obsolete starting date specification in informed consent form
Definition: A date specification in an informed consent form that specifies the starting date of an investigation.

The process of making the decision of the competent authorities in form of a letter, document, or verbal or electronic form, that confirms that somebody has permission to do something or be somewhere, e.g. to realize a given project.

Term Label: obsolete storage duration of signed informed consent form
Definition: None
A document part that describes the action types to be permitted.

A process that is carried out by a conscious being or an aggregate of conscious beings, and is spontaneous, directed towards another conscious being or another aggregate of conscious beings, and that needs to be perceived.
A medical record that describes a patient's mental health care history.

Term Label: obsolete archiving signed electronic informed consent form
Definition: A process of storage of signed informed consent form when the form is in digital format.
A document part that is specified as a place to receive a signature.
A disorder that involves some structural damage that is immediately caused by a catastrophic external force.

Term Label: obsolete date specification in informed consent form
Definition: A data item that indicates a date that specified on an informed consent form.
A directive information entity that prescribes information that must be revealed and prescribes to whom that information must be revealed.

Term Label: obsolete effective date specification in informed consent form
Definition: A date specification in an informed consent form that specifies an effective date of an investigation.

Term Label: obsolete allowed research scope in informed consent form
Definition: A part of informed consent form that specifies the scope of allowed research and is derived from a research protocol.
An investigation that requires an informed consent process.
A role that represents the eligibility of a candidate according to a study protocol.
A planned process that involves the filling of a questionnaire form that includes a list of questions.

Term Label: ICO Classes to Move to RUBRIC
Definition: None
An investigation that involves human research.
A relation holding between an instance of a deontic role and an instance of an intentional action when the deontic role bearer participates in the intentional action and is allowed to do so.
An act of permitting that is a process part of some informed consent process and has output some consenter role and has output some permission role.
A deontic role that is output of some Act of Consent and, in some contexts, may be realized in revoking or modifying the permission role that was output of the same Act of Consent.

Term Label: obsolete explaining benefits of participation to participant candidate
Definition: The potential benefit to the study subject that may arise from participating the study research is to be explained to candidate

A role that is the output of an act of assent and which inheres in a human being, who, because they fail to satisfy certain criteria for consent, is thereby allowed the aid of a legal representative who aids them in an Act of Consent, and, in some contexts, may be realized in revoking or modifying the permission role that was output of the same Act of Assent.

Term Label: obsolete informed consent form for genetic study
Definition: An informed consent form that is designed for use in genetic studies.

Term Label: obsolete part of informed consent form
Definition: A document that is a part of an informed consent form.
A one-dimensional temporal region to which an investigation stands in the occupies_temporal_region relation.
An anonymized information content entity about a genomic sample.

Term Label: obsolete explaining to participant candidate in informed consent process
Definition: None
None
An informed consent process in which a parent reaches a decision concerning whether or not to grant consent on a minor's behalf, when the minor is incapable of providing consent for themselves.
None
An informed consent form that contains sections specific to procedures in vaccination.
A deontic role, which may be realized in an Act of Consent, where the bearer of the legal representative role consents on behalf of a person who lacks the capability to provide consent.

A planned process in which a person or their legal representative is informed about key facts about potential risks and benefits of a process and makes a documented decision as to whether the person in question will participate.
None

Term Label: obsolete contact person for questions about research
Definition: a person who is the contact for questions about research.
A planned process in which a biological sample from a subject is collected for testing.
A rule in an informed consent regulatory document that prescribes either an informed consent process or deontic roles inhering in agents that participate in an informed consent process.

A specially constituted independent review body comprised of medical, scientific and non-scientific members established and designated by an entity to ensure the protection of the rights, safety and well-being of human subjects recruited to participate in biomedical or behavioral research according to the requirements outlined in Title 38, part 16 (same as Title 45, part 46 and Title 21, part 56) of the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations. IRB responsibility include but not limited to the reviewing, approving, and providing continuing review of trial protocol and amendments and of the methods and material to be used in obtaining and documenting informed consent of the trial. Other equivalent committees with the same or similar functions are also considered to be IRBs.
A document part that describes the harm that accompany participation and their likelihoods.
A cognitive capability inhering in some agent, which may be realized in an Act of Consent.

Term Label: informed consent form for clinical research involving children
Definition: An informed consent form for clinical study that involves children.

A document that explains all relevant information to assist a human being in understanding the expectations and requirements of participation in a process, and is an instrument in obtaining consent and, after having obtained consent, is a record that such a consent has occurred.
The process that shares the information under the informed consent context
A date specification that designates the date when a project ends.

Term Label: obsolete informed consent form containing questionnaire
Definition: An informed consent form that contains a questionnaire section.

Information, including demographic data, that relates to: the individual’s past, present or future physical or mental health or condition, the provision of health care to the individual, or the past, present, or future payment for the provision of health care to the individual, and that identifies the individual or for which there is a reasonable basis to believe it can be used to identify the individual.
A capability to consent that is sufficiently robust as to pass the legal requirements of some socio-legal jurisdiction.
An investigation that targets drug testing.
An investigation that involves animal research.
A planned process to screen the eligibility of a candidate for a study or procedure, verifying whether certain sufficient or necessary conditions for eligibility obtain.
An informed consent for an unspecified range of future research subject to a few content or process restrictions.
A part of an informed consent form that is required for the form to be used in an informed consent process.
A planned process that involves the filling of an informed consent form.

Term Label: obsolete informed consent form for storage and future use of unused samples
Definition: An informed consent form that is used for a storage and future use of unused samples.

Term Label: authorization for release of confidential health information
Definition: An authorization that signed by a patient, or his legal representative, or clinical study participant for the use or disclosure of oral, written, or electronic form of confidential health information that identifies the individual and relates to the medical history, diagnosis, treatment, or prognosis of his condition.
A study that is a clinical trial that requires an informed consent process.

Term Label: investigator signature section in informed consent form
Definition: A signature section in an informed consent form that is specified as a place to receive a signature from an investigator.
An investigation that targets cancer research.

Term Label: obsolete informed consent form signed by human subject
Definition: An informed consent form that has been signed by a human subject
A planned process that involves using data which was an output of a human being's participation in a study and which is about that human being.

Term Label: is associated with review board approval number
Definition: A relation that links an informed consent form to an associated IRB number.
A document that is the output of an authorization process.

Term Label: obsolete explaining sample process and usage to participant candidate
Definition: In order to make sure that the candidate is informed adequately from his or her perspective, the process of collecting, storing or destroying the sample collected from the study subject is to be explained.
An agent who bears a consenter role.
None
A document part that specifies a date.
A filled multiple choice text entity that records a response indicating 'yes' to a multiple choice question.
An agent who bears an assenter role.

Term Label: obsolete completely filled informed consent form
Definition: An informed consent form that has been filled with all required contents.

Term Label: informed assent form for child or minor
Definition: An informed consent form that is adapted to the cognitive capacities of a child or minor.
A deontic declaration that has permittee role to do genetic research on a human donor as a specified outcome.

A document that explains relevant information regarding the expectations and requirements of participation in a research study or clinical procedure, is adapted to the cognitive capacities of that individual so as to assist in that individual's understanding, and is designed to record the assent of that individual.

An informed consent process in which the participant is not able to read and write in the language of the informed consent form, but is aided in understanding the informed consent process by a translation into the agent's native language.
A role that inheres in a person who performs an eligibility screening process.

Term Label: ethics rule specification in informed consent
Definition: An informed consent rule specification that specifies the ethics in informed consent.
A questionnaire that is filled up with answers.
A stasis of generically dependent continuant that has participant some document and during which that document is recognized within that jurisdiction and directs governance within that jurisdiction.
A directive information entity that prescribes a deontic role that permits some action that has part trigger condition description.
None

A questionnaire with a set of questions and choices which help identify an eligibility criterion, such that the answers to these questions enable determination whether or not the person is eligible to participate.
A trigger condition description that nullifies some other prescription or obligation.
A descriptive information content entity that reports that participation in the procedures described elsewhere in the document are voluntary.
A description of allowed action types that has in view a wide, unspecified range of action types, and is restricted only by a regulator body.
A planned process that results in a legally effective consent status.
A process in which some independent continuant endures and one or more of the dependent entities it bears does not change in kind or intensity.
A temporal region during which an act is (or acts are) permitted.
An object property that represents a relation between a form and the person or organization who acts as a signer and signs the form.
A planned process that approves an informed consent form.

Term Label: obsolete explaining study derived data usage to participant candidate
Definition: In the case of promoting future data sharing, the usage of the data derived from a study is to be explained to the candidate.

Term Label: obsolete informed consent form signing date
Definition: A date when an informed consent form is signed.
A regulatory document designed to prescribe research involving human subjects.
A descriptive information content entity that describes a medical procedure.
An object property that represents a relation between a unique identifier (ID) and an organization that assigns the ID.

Term Label: obsolete informed consent form for clinical study
Definition: An informed consent form that is used for a clinical study.
An information content entity that has been processed to prevent the identification of the person with whom the data are associated, thereby enduring in a stasis of anonymization.

Term Label: obsolete explaining study protocol to participant candidate
Definition: In order to make sure that the candidate is informed adequately from his or her perspective, the protocol of the study including the protocol of participating, for example, what kind of procedure the participant will be involved, how many scheduled visits will be explained.

Term Label: obsolete consenting to not to be informed about incidental finding
Definition: An informed consent for a subject agrees not to be informed about any incidental finding.

Term Label: obsolete process of providing broad consent for research with biological sample
Definition: A broad consent that is for an unspecified range of future research subject to a few content or process restrictions with biological sample.
A document that certifies that 1) a person may perform some action, or 2) which provides authentication for a claim, or 3) which confirms position or status.
A human subject who provides informed consent without a legal guardian.
An informed consent process in which the participant communicates consent orally rather than by filling out and signing a written form.
None

A trigger condition description describing some person or group of people who either a) bear a disposition of vulnerability or b) are of a type whose instances are known to frequently bear a disposition of vulnerability.
An organization that has a deontic power role prescribed by some regulatory document that occurs in a stasis of regulation.
A directive information entity that specifies a human being who is to bear a contact role.

Term Label: obsolete contact person in informed consent process
Definition: A person who can be contacted during an informed consent process.
A directive information entity that prescribes the limits of disclosure regarding an agent’s identity.

Term Label: obsolete legally effective consented participant role
Definition: A role that inheres in a human being who participates in a consenting process and eventually becomes legally effectively consented.
A directive information entity that prescribes actions that are impermissible that has part trigger condition description.
A benefit is a disposition or the potential positive effects that may arise from participating in a study.
A biological sample collecting in which a blood sample from a subject is collected for testing.
A processual entity whose completion is hypothesized (by a healthcare provider) to alleviate the signs and symptoms associated with a disorder
A stasis of regulation that has participant some document and during which that document is recognized as a law within the jurisdiction in which the stasis of regulation is occurring.
A planned process in which an agent's designated biological specimen is collected after the death of the agent.
An authorization process aims to release the medical record.

Term Label: obsolete informed consent form for qualitative study
Definition: An informed consent form that is used for a qualitative study.

Term Label: obsolete informed consent form for human saliva sample collection
Definition: An informed consent form for human sample collection that is specifically for human saliva sample collection.

Term Label: obsolete consenting to the secondary use of EHR
Definition: None

Term Label: consenting not to have financial benefit
Definition: An informed consent for a subject agrees not to have financial benefit in the future.

Term Label: obsolete informed consent form for quantitative study
Definition: None
An investigation that is conducted with the purpose of earning a profit.
None
A review board approval number that is assigned by an institutional review board.

Term Label: obsolete expiration date specification in informed consent form
Definition: A date specification in an informed consent form that specifies the expiration date of an investigation.

Term Label: informed assent form for mentally impaired
Definition: An informed consent form that is adapted to the cognitive capacities of someone with significant mental impairment.
A planned process that revokes a permission role inhering in some agent.

Term Label: obsolete planned duration of study subject participation
Definition: A participation time that is the total length of time of subject's participation in a research study; from the time of enrollment to the completion of follow-up.
None
A textual entity that denotes an investigation.
A material entity which is clinically abnormal and part of an extended organism. Disorders are the physical basis of disease.

Term Label: obsolete explaining record confidentiality to participant candidate
Definition: In order to enable the candidate to make voluntary decision, the options for enhancing the protection of confidentiality for participants who have contributed personal information to a study is to be explained.
A role borne by an agent that, if realized, is realized in an investigation.
A planned process that involves altering an information content entity that is associated with an individual, such that such association is lost or inaccessible.
A treatment currently in wide use and approved by a regulatory body or health authority, considered to be effective in the treatment of a specific disease or condition.

Term Label: obsolete assessment of participant candidate understanding
Definition: In order for the consent valid, the candidate should be competent to understand what has been explained.

Term Label: US federal policy for the protection of human subjects
Definition: A directive information entity that specifies US federal policy for the protection of human subjects.
A cancer research investigation that specifically targets metastatic melanoma research.

Term Label: informed consent form for human blood sample collection
Definition: An informed consent form for human sample collection that is specifically for human blood sample collection.
A role inhering in a participant who meets all eligibility criteria defined within a study protocol.

Term Label: obsolete archiving signed informed consent form
Definition: A planned process that collects a signed  informed consent form. During this process, the information is systematically kept in a repository.

Term Label: obsolete consenting to be contacted for tissue research
Definition: None
A role that inheres in an agent and which is externally grounded in the personal normative expectations of other agents within a social context.
A character string that is assigned by a review board upon approval of a study.
All individually identifiable health information held or transmitted by a covered entity or its business associate, in any form or media, whether electronic, paper, or oral.
A deontic role that inheres in an agent and which permits certain actions.
A directive information entity that prescribes a deontic role that permits some action.
A descriptive information content entity that describes some state of affairs such that, if that state of affairs holds, some other prescription follows.

Legal name is the person name that identifies a person for legal, administrative, or other official purposes. A person's first legal name generally is the name of the person that was given for the purpose of registration of the birth and which then appears on a birth certificate (see birth name), but may change subsequently.
A role inhering in an agent that allows that agent to revoke, change, or create a deontic role.
A directive information entity that prescribes a deontic power role or the process that realizes it.

Term Label: obsolete informed consent form for human urine biospecimen collection
Definition: An informed consent form designed for use in human urine collection.
A biological sample collecting in which a tissue sample from a subject is collected for testing.
None
A social act in which an agent bearing a deontic power role and realizes that role in the creation of a permission role.
A directive information entity that prescribes an obligation that is realized a deontic role that is the output of a document act and that has part trigger condition description.
A role borne by a human being who is part of a group of individuals and acts as a contact person for the group.

Term Label: obsolete human subject unable to give informed consent
Definition: A human subject who is unable to give informed consent. In this case, another person is generally authorized to give consent on his behalf, e.g., parents or legal guardians of a child, though in this circumstance the child may be required to provide informed assent, and conservators for the mentally ill.
An investigation that has process part some genetic analysis.
A planned process that validates an informed consent form.

Term Label: obsolete signing an informed consent form
Definition: A document act that is a part of an informed consent process and has output of a signed informed consent form. The signing process leads to a legal obligation.

Term Label: obsolete option to check in informed consent form
Definition: A part of an informed consent form that specifies an optional element within the form.

Term Label: obsolete human blood sample collection section
Definition: A document part that describes and specifies human blood sample collection procedures.
An organization charged with approving clinical study protocols and ensuring that applicable governing rules and laws are upheld.
An information content entity that consists of a set of propositions that describe some entity.

A document act input document that explains all relevant information to assist a human being in understanding the expectations and requirements of participation in a process, and whose purpose is to assist in obtaining consent.

Term Label: obsolete Walgreens vaccine informed consent form'
Definition: An informed consent form that is used for vaccination by Walgreens
An informed consent form that has been signed by at least one participant.
None
A directive information entity that, when signed, stamped, or initialed realizes a deontic role as described by the document specifications, or specifications in another related document.
A directive information entity that prescribes an obligation that is realized a deontic role that is the output of a document act.

A deontic power role that, if realized, may permit an Act of Consent and thereby create a permission role, or revoke or modify a previously provided permission role created by permitting an Act of Consent.
A planned process placing a specimen in some location in order to maintain possession of it.
A document part that describes the benefit that accompany participation and their likelihoods.
An act of communicating one’s agreement.
A part of informed consent form that is not required.
A planned process in which an agent ceases to participate in a study.
A temporal interval during which a human being participates in a process.
A deontic role that, if realized, is realized in the creation, modification, or revoking of other deontic roles.
